title: Carpool moment with PM Modi, banquet dinner & trade decisions ‚Äî highlights from Putin‚Äôs visit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin concluded his two-day state visit to India, marked by a warm reception from PM Modi and discussions on strengthening bilateral ties. Key outcomes included a new economic cooperation program aiming for $100 billion trade by 2030 and a focus on peace efforts in Ukraine.

title: 'Taking strict action': Centre ramps up response amid IndiGo meltdown ‚Äî what we know so far
content: Union civil aviation minister Ram Mohan Naidu has vowed strict action against those responsible for IndiGo's massive flight disruptions, caused by pilot-rostering issues. A committee is investigating the problem, while the DGCA has granted exemptions to help restore normalcy. IndiGo has apologized and offered waivers to affected passengers as operations slowly improve.

title: Putin to Trump? Russia ready for ‚Äòuninterrupted fuel shipments‚Äô to India
content: Amidst US sanctions on Russian oil majors, President Putin has assured India of consistent energy supplies, including oil, gas, and coal. This comes as India faces US pressure over its crude oil trade with Russia.  Beyond fossil fuels, Russia is also deepening collaboration with India in nuclear energy, transport logistics, and advanced technology sectors.

title: Gurgaon hit-and-run: Businessman killed; 22-year-old unlicensed driver arrested
content: A 58-year-old cyclist was tragically killed in a hit-and-run on Akashneem Marg, Gurgaon. The driver, a 22-year-old unlicensed housekeeping staffer, borrowed a bouncer's car and struck the cyclist from behind before fleeing. CCTV footage aided police in identifying and arresting the driver, who now faces multiple charges.

title: ‚ÄòMetaverse‚Äô budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly slashing its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its ambitious virtual reality vision after incurring over $70 billion in losses. This move comes as the company doubles down on artificial intelligence, investing heavily in AI infrastructure and talent acquisition.

title: Putin promises non-stop energy, PM says Russia ties like pole star
content: India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties, signing over a dozen agreements to boost economic partnership to $100 billion by 2030. Both nations committed to uninterrupted fuel shipments and discussed civil nuclear cooperation. Discussions also covered defense, manpower mobility, and India's UN Security Council bid, with leaders expressing satisfaction with the summit's outcomes.

title: Chaos at Bengaluru airport: Father says daughter needs sanitary pad; IndiGo gives no help
content: IndiGo flight cancellations have plunged Kempegowda International Airport into chaos, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded, hungry, and without basic facilities. Travelers faced a severe lack of essentials like sanitary pads and food, with some resorting to arduous bus journeys due to ongoing uncertainty. The situation highlights significant operational disruptions and passenger distress.

title: 'Insane': How Elon Musk reacted to EU's $140m fine on X & why was it penalised
content: Elon Musk denounced the EU's $140 million fine on X as "crazy" and "insane," criticizing the penalty for violating transparency rules under the Digital Services Act. Regulators cited deceptive design practices with the blue checkmark system and shortcomings in X's ad database. The ruling has drawn criticism from US officials who view it as an attack on American tech platforms.

title: 'Firms overspending on AI': Anthropic CEO admits; separates technological and economical sides
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei is confident that massive AI infrastructure spending will yield significant economic returns, despite acknowledging considerable risk. He separates technological advancements, which he believes are robust, from economic outcomes. Amodei highlighted Anthropic's own 10x annual revenue growth over three years as a strong indicator of AI's value for enterprise clients, predicting continued rapid, albeit slowing, growth.

title: ‚ÄòBabri‚Äô event row: Calcutta HC orders Bengal govt to pull out all stops; beef up security
content: Calcutta High Court has ordered the Bengal government to prevent communal unrest in Murshidabad's Beldanga ahead of a suspended TMC MLA's controversial "Babri Masjid" foundation-laying ceremony on December 6.  Authorities have deployed significant security forces to maintain law and order, with the MLA proceeding with arrangements despite the court's directive.

title: Bidaai fame Sara Khan ties the knot as per Hindu rituals
content: Newlyweds Sara Khan and Krish Pathak celebrated their Hindu wedding on December 5, following a court marriage in October. The couple, who met on a dating app a year ago, hosted a reception in Mumbai attended by friends and family. Sara looked radiant in a red lehenga, while Krish complemented her in a black sherwani.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife‚Äôs donations: Scott cuts Amazon stake; gives millions to DEI causes
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Airport chaos: India‚Äôs World Cup winner stranded for 12 hours; slams IndiGo
content: IndiGo faces widespread passenger anger and flight disruptions due to new pilot rest regulations. Thousands were stranded, including cricketer Madan Lal, as over 1,000 flights were cancelled. The airline admitted to planning gaps and expects full normalisation between December 10 and 15.

title: Bengal: Suspended TMC MLA to lay 'Babri Masjid' foundation stone in Murshidabad;
content: Murshidabad braces for a tense Saturday as suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir plans to inaugurate a structure named "Babri Masjid."  Authorities have deployed over 3,500 security personnel following a Calcutta High Court directive to prevent communal unrest. Kabir insists the event will be peaceful, focusing solely on religious recitation, while the TMC denies involvement, alleging a political conspiracy.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs candid comments on Taylor Swift spark fresh future speculation
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Candace Owens slammed for ‚Äòrunning scared‚Äô from Charlie Kirk livestream
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Aryna Sabalenka & Georgios Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements, business
content: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding a√ßa√≠ company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors may re-sign $190M guard to help Stephen Curry
content: Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a reunion with former star Klay Thompson, now with the Dallas Mavericks. Amidst organizational shifts in Dallas and the Warriors' ongoing search for consistent three-point shooting, a trade for Thompson is being discussed. His return could bolster Golden State's offense and recapture championship magic.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026 draw: Argentina begin title defence vs Algeria
content: Lionel Messi and Argentina will open their title defense against Algeria, with further group-stage fixtures against Austria and tournament debutants Jordan in Group J. Spain, among the leading contenders and current European champions, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde before facing Uruguay and Saudi Arabia in Group H.

title: ‚ÄòTreated worse than animals‚Äô: 12 labourers from UP reportedly stranded in Kyrgyzstan
content: Twelve labourers from Pilibhit are reportedly stranded and facing severe harassment in Kyrgyzstan.  Families allege they were sent by local agents on misleading contracts, paid hefty sums, and are now subjected to brutal treatment and denied return.  The district administration has submitted a detailed report to the UP Home Department, initiating steps for their safe repatriation.

title: Feud over cow dung ends in murder: DU student stabbed to death in family brawl; 2 arrested
content: A Delhi University student was tragically stabbed to death in Sangam Vihar after intervening in a dispute between his mother and aunt over household waste. The 27-year-old LLB student's attempt to de-escalate the argument reportedly led to a violent confrontation with relatives, resulting in his fatal injury. Police have apprehended two individuals and are searching for others involved.

title: Pan masala cess gets Lok Sabha nod in boost to defence priorities
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated the government aims to prevent UPA-era defence shortages by ensuring a steady revenue stream for modern warfare capabilities. A new cess on pan masala manufacturing units will fund national security and public health, addressing concerns about potential price drops and health impacts.

title: Ring missing? Mandhana's first post since wedding postponement - Watch
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana broke her social media silence with a toothpaste ad post, sparking speculation due to her missing engagement ring. Her wedding to Palash Muchhal was indefinitely postponed due to family medical emergencies, with recent nazar emojis in bios addressing further rumours.  Mandhana is set to return to cricket soon.

title: FDTL norms on hold: Govt steps in to fix IndiGo chaos; normalcy eyed by Dec 15
content: The government has temporarily suspended new pilot duty time rules to ease IndiGo's widespread flight cancellations, aiming for normalcy by December 15. This decision, made in the interest of passengers, follows significant disruptions and a substantial market value loss for IndiGo. Pilots' associations, however, criticize the move, citing safety concerns and questioning the airline's preparation.

title: 'He will decide India‚Äôs fate': Ex-India star picks X-factor for T20 World Cup
content: Irfan Pathan explains Rinku Singh's T20I squad exclusion, citing Hardik Pandya's return as the primary reason.  Pathan believes this squad is largely set for the 2026 T20 World Cup, emphasizing Hardik Pandya's pivotal role in India's global campaign and the need for clarity in pace and spin combinations.

title: Michael Annett dies at 39: Cause of former NASCAR star‚Äôs death and family reaction
content: Former NASCAR driver Michael Annett has passed away at 39, his former team JR Motorsports announced. Annett, a respected figure, achieved a significant victory at Daytona in the 2019 Xfinity Series. His career, marked by perseverance and skill, saw him race for various teams since 2008. The cause of his death remains undisclosed, leaving the motorsport community in mourning.

title: Russia makes first delivery of Nuclear-fuel for TN nuclear plant's 3rd unit
content: Undeterred by global pressures, Russia has commenced nuclear fuel deliveries for Kudankulam's third unit, reinforcing its commitment to uninterrupted energy cooperation with India. This marks the first VVER-1000 fuel shipment under a new contract, promising extended operational cycles and improved performance for India's growing nuclear power capacity.

title: Complaint filed against Aryan for flashing middle finger
content: A complaint has been filed against Aryan Khan, son of Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan, for allegedly flashing the middle finger toward the crowd during a public event held at a Bengaluru pub on November 28. The incident, captured in viral videos, sparked online outrage and prompted legal action.

title: ‚ÄòDhurandhar‚Äô Day 1 Box Office: Ranveer‚Äôs film is 2025‚Äôs second-highest opener
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered box office records, becoming this year's second-highest opener with ‚Çπ27 crore net on its first day. The film outperformed 'Saiyaara' and marks Ranveer Singh's highest opener ever, surpassing previous hits like 'Padmaavat' and 'Simmba'. Inspired by true events, the ensemble cast has been praised, though the runtime drew some criticism.

title: ‚ÄòExclusive rights over temple rituals‚Äô, TN defends defying HC order in SC
content: Tamil Nadu's DMK government sought an urgent Supreme Court hearing on its appeal against the Madras High Court's order allowing the 'Karthigai Deepam' lighting atop Thiruparankundram hills. The state claims exclusive rights over temple rituals, defying the HC's directives. The SC acknowledged the plea but offered no immediate assurance for an early listing.

title: Cardi B‚Äôs wild twerk show at Stefon Diggs‚Äô birthday leaves fans stunned
content: Cardi B's energetic twerk performance at Stefon Diggs' Miami birthday bash has set the internet ablaze. The rapper's celebratory dance, set to Metro Boomin's track, captured widespread attention, highlighting the couple's high-profile romance. This viral moment underscores the public's fascination with Cardi B's life, from her relationships to her public appearances, ensuring their continued presence in trending topics.

title: Driving patterns that reveal early signs of cognitive decline and memory loss
content: Your driving habits might be an early indicator of brain health, according to new research. Subtle changes like avoiding night drives or sticking to familiar routes could signal cognitive decline years before memory loss is apparent. This real-world data offers a powerful, proactive way to screen for potential issues, prompting timely medical attention and intervention.

title: Alia Bhatt‚Äôs Mumbai griha pravesh shines with her Manish Malhotra tissue silk saree
content: Alia Bhatt turns her Mumbai home‚Äôs griha pravesh into a royal runway in an alluring tissue silk saree by fashion maestro Manish Malhotra.

title: JDU politician stirs pot again, says many want Nitish‚Äôs son in politics
content: JDU's working president Sanjay Kumar Jha indicated that party members and supporters desire for Nishant Kumar, son of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, to enter politics. Jha stated the decision rests with the 49-year-old engineer. Nishant, who has recently increased his public presence and praised his father's governance, declined to comment on the matter.

title: Home loan interest rates set to fall to historic low of 7.1% after RBI move
content: Home loan rates are poised to fall to Covid-era lows following a 25 basis point repo rate cut by the RBI. This move is expected to lower EMIs for borrowers, though banks may need to adjust deposit rates. Non-banking finance companies anticipate immediate benefits from reduced funding costs, aiding last-mile financiers and small businesses.

title: India, Russia agree to boost efforts on joint climate action
content: India and Russia have pledged to boost joint efforts on climate action, aligning with global UN goals and the Paris Agreement. Both nations will collaborate on increasing climate finance and technology access for developing countries. They also agreed to intensify dialogue on carbon trading, low-carbon technologies, and sustainable finance, while continuing cooperation within G20, Brics, and SCO.

title: Maha civic polls result after Dec 20 voting: SC upholds HC order
content: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for the immediate declaration of Maharashtra civic election results, dismissing any further delays due to pending High Court cases. The apex court ruled that results for all municipal bodies will be announced after the final round of voting on December 20, irrespective of ongoing legal challenges.

title: Dying declaration can‚Äôt be rejected due to time lag: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that a dying declaration remains valid even if there's a time gap before the victim's death, and it doesn't need to be made under immediate threat. Such statements, even if not recorded by a magistrate or medically certified for mental fitness, are admissible. This decision allows prosecution of in-laws in a dowry death case.

title: US journalist injured in landmine blast in Chin state‚Äôs Tedin Township
content: In a harrowing turn of events, American journalist Collin Mayfield is currently receiving medical care at Ebenezer Hospital in Aizawl following a landmine explosion in Myanmar's Chin state. The incident occurred on November 18 as Mayfield reported on fierce clashes near Kennedy Peak.

title: CFP chaos scenarios for every league and what to watch in nine conference titles
content: Bill Connelly looks at key angles for all nine games -- and why the playoff committee could get a headache.

title: Penn State hires Cyclones' Campbell as new coach
content: Penn State named Iowa State coach Matt Campbell as the school's head football coach, the school announced Friday.

title: 'No heart': Ex-star Cousins rips UK after ugly loss
content: Former Kentucky star DeMarcus Cousins didn't hold back on his opinion on the Wildcats after their 35-point loss to No. 11 Gonzaga on Friday night, saying the team "has no heart."

title: On Wilt's heels, Durant 8th ever to hit 31K points
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant, who entered Friday as the NBA's No. 8 all-time leading scorer, reached the 31,000-point milestone in the first quarter against the Suns.

title: Poch: USMNT can't be complacent after WC draw
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said his objective over the next six months is to continue to improve the squad and "show full respect" for its World Cup group stage opponents.

title: Cool it! JMU AD scolds fans for throwing snowballs
content: James Madison athletic director Matt Roan used the public-address microphone to implore Dukes fans to stop throwing snowballs onto the field during the Sun Belt Conference championship game.

title: Schottenheimer: Will talk to Pickens about post
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer said he will have a conversation with George Pickens about the wide receiver's social media post, which he has since deleted, in response to criticism he received from former All-Pro cornerback Richard Sherman.

title: Kansas star Peterson on track to play vs. Mizzou
content: Darryn Peterson, ESPN's projected No. 1 pick in the 2026 NBA draft, "should" be available for Kansas' matchup against rival Missouri on Sunday in Kansas City, coach Bill Self said Friday.

title: Someone had to 'challenge NASCAR,' Jordan says
content: Retired NBA great Michael Jordan testified Friday at the NASCAR antitrust trial that "someone had to step forward and challenge the entity" over its current business model.

content: Here's our latest intel heading into the MLB winter meetings, starting with the slugger who holds the key to the offseason.

content: With every win, Detroit and its young core are moving further away from the dregs of a grueling rebuild.

content: Four sacks shy of making NFL history, the Cleveland Browns veteran is among the all-time great pass rushers.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Why are so many NHL games going to overtime? Five theories from players, coaches, execs
content: Through 425 games, 27.3% have gone past regulation. If that holds, it would be the highest rate since 2005-06.

content: The Capitals, Penguins and Flyers are the big risers this week, with the Ducks, Devils and Mammoth sliding.

content: Giannis paired with Steph Curry? Kevin Durant? Victor Wembanyama?! NBA insiders break down five deals the Bucks could consider.

title: üïö Big Ben, Harrison call for Tomlin-Steelers split
content: Two Steelers legends have joined the chorus of voices calling for the franchise to move on from Mike Tomlin, with Ben Roethlisberger even suggesting that Tomlin is a good fit for the vacant Penn State job.

title: üèÄ Clippers abruptly sever ties with Chris Paul
content: Chris Paul, one of the greatest players in Clippers franchise history, posted an Instagram story a little before 3 a.m. ET Wednesday that he had just learned he was being sent home to Los Angeles from Atlanta.

content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

content: As both sides continue negotiations ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline, housing emerged as an issue in the latest proposal.

content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Jaguars' passing game and Titans defense.

content: Alleged non-compliance with court verdict regarding evacuation, demolition, and reconstruction of the twin towers

title: Bold and brave, a tribute to armed forces heroes of Telangana
content: Book titled ‚ÄòBold & Brave‚Äô highlights heroic deeds of Telangana‚Äôs gallantry awardees whose courage spans battlefields, disasters and decades of service, and honours their sacrifice while inspiring future generations to embrace the armed forces with pride and unwavering spirit

title: Former Osmania University Vice Chancellor D.C. Reddy no more
content: Under Mr. Reddy, the university saw several academic reforms, including the introduction of semester system in postgraduate courses and administrative development

title: Karnataka leads in solarising public health facilities, 3,600 centres adopt solar power under Saura Swasthya initiative
content: The project is expected to benefit more than three crore rural residents by enabling uninterrupted power supply to government hospitals

title: Electric tractor mela showcases clean, low-cost farm mechanisation in Karnataka
content: A key feature was the launch of the NRDC‚Äôs report, Powering Agriculture, which claims that electric tractors offer up to 80% lower operating costs, 50% lower ownership costs, and significant health benefits for farmers

title: Kerala local body polls: Delimitation redraws Alappuzha district‚Äôs political battleground
content: Beyond vote share trends lie regional issues, including growing disenchantment among paddy farmers and fears of displacement over the coastal highway project, that have the potential to change political ground

title: Kerala local body polls: Land crunch shrinks¬†Munnar‚Äôs¬†ward count after delimitation
content: Absence of land for house construction has resulted in families shifting to nearby panchayats, which has led in the ward numbers decreasing to 20 from 21 after delimitation

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF seeks mandate with measured confidence amid political crosswinds
content: Facing both achievements and controversies, the LDF approaches the local body elections seeking momentum for a third term in Kerala. While its decade-long welfare and development record anchors the campaign, internal frictions, high-profile cases, and shifting community dynamics shape a complex political terrain.

title: Maharashtra installs over 45,000 solar agricultural pumps in a month, claims world record
content: Maharashtra has so far installed 7.47 lakh solar pumps in the State and targets to set up a total of 10.45 lakh pumps

title: India weighs greater phone-location surveillance; Apple, Google and Samsung protest
content: India‚Äôs government is reviewing a telecom industry proposal to force smartphone firms to enable satellite location tracking that is always activated for better surveillance

title: DRDO hands over seven technologies developed under tech development fund to armed forces
content: The Committee undertook detailed discussions on a wide spectrum of project proposals and approved 12 new projects spanning across strategic, aerospace, naval and electronic warfare technologies, the ministry said

title: At least five killed, seven injured as car rams into stationary vehicle near Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Keelakarai
content: A senior police officer said the Keelakarai vehicle belonged to a DMK functionary who was out with friends, with his driver at the wheel

title: Gujarat farmer distress: Where cotton clouds hang heavy
content: Following heavy rainfall in October and the subsequent drop in the price of cotton, six farmers have died by suicide in Gujarat. The Union government‚Äôs decision to allow duty-free cotton imports has only added to their woes.¬†A.M. Jigeesh¬†reports on how farmers in Gujarat‚Äôs cotton belt are calling for government intervention

title: Seema Punia gets 16-month ban for failing dope test
content: Seema Punia's suspension came into force on November 10 ‚Äî the date of the decision by the Anti-Doping Disciplinary Panel (ADDP) ‚Äî as per the updated list of dope offenders by the National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA)

title: Pressure mounts on Raj Bhavan to grant age relaxation to job aspirants in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Protests are being held by aspirants under the open merit category, demanding an increase in the current upper age limit from 32 to 37

title: Delhi University law student stabbed to death in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar; 2 held
content: Irshad, a first-year LLB student at Delhi University's Campus Law Centre, had multiple stab injuries, the police said.

title: Prasar Bharati signs MoUs with Russian media organisations
content: The organisations include Joint Stock Company Gazprom-media Holding; National Media Group, BIG ASIA Media Group, ANO TV-Novosti, and TV BRICS

title: International tiger trafficker held by M.P. tiger strike force from Sikkim
content: Yangchen Lachungpa (44), wanted under an INTERPOL Red Notice and involved in alleged trafficking of tiger body parts, was held from Lachung in North Sikkim on December 2, based on intelligence inputs and coordinated ground action

title: Debutant faces veterans in Ponnurunni East poll battle
content: LDF candidate Beena Divakaran, though a newcomer, is confident of the dominance of the front in the division where it has not tasted defeat in over four decades; three-time councillor Sunitha Dixon, BJP candidate, and UDF‚Äôs Jain Gray are her opponents

title: Manipur‚Äôs banned outfits warned against disrupting peace
content: A coalition of five armed groups threatened people who attended the recently concluded Sangai Festival with punitive action

title: Ernakulam reports highest number of influenza infections in Kerala
content: A total of 340 cases and two deaths, one each in Thiruvananthapuram and Malappuram, were reported in November

title: Path paved to link India‚Äôs skill base with Russia‚Äôs demand for labourers
content: Moscow is reported to need 5,00,000 semi-skilled workers; a formal agreement aims to facilitate safe mobility

title: Surprise inspections in Education Department offices in Bengaluru reveal computers, UPS units, and LED smart TVs were overpriced
content: During video calls with school headmasters, Lokayukta teams found that headmasters were not present during school hours

title: "Hard Work Wasted": IndiGo Cancellations Leave Passengers In Tears
content: Long queues, passengers in tears, and repeated flight cancellations created a morning of severe disruption at Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Saturday, as IndiGo continued to face nationwide operational delays.

title: "Not Could Be, It Will Be": Aviation Minister On Action Against IndiGo
content: Ram Mohan Naidu told NDTV that all other airlines have faced no problems despite the new Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) norms coming into effect in November.

title: Nitish Kumar's Son Nishant Kumar May Soon Enter Bihar Politics: JDU Leader
content: Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's son, Nishant Kumar, is now poised to enter Bihar politics, with strong indications coming from Sanjay Kumar Jha, the national working president of the JD-U and a close confidant of the Chief Minister.

title: Sonia Gandhi Targets BJP Over Nehru Criticism, A Surname Counter Follows
content: The project to vilify Jawaharlal Nehru is the main goal of the ruling establishment today, Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has said, ripping into the BJP for allegedly trying to erase the first prime minister from the country's history.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Navigating the Tightrope: Why Putin's Visit Is A Masterclass In India's Foreign Policy
content: India's engagement with Russia is not without risks. Its decision to host the summit, nonetheless, and continue its trade ties despite overt disapproval from the West, is a clear exercise of strategic autonomy.

title: IndiGo Flight Crisis Live Updates: Delhi Airport Says Airline's Ops Getting Back To Normal
content: The cancellation and delay of all domestic flights of IndiGo departing from Delhi entered the fifth day on Saturday. The issue has affected tens of thousands of passengers who are worried about extended delays and soaring travel costs.

title: Road Rage On Camera: J&K Cop Slaps Man, Tosses His Phone After Argument
content: A disturbing video has emerged from Jammu and Kashmir's Doda, where a man alleged that he was assaulted and wrongfully detained by a police officer.

title: Jhol Momo To Badam Halwa: Inside Lavish State Dinner Hosted For Putin At Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: The culinary delight for the Russian President showcased India's rich regional delicacies on a traditional 'thali'.

title: Suspended Trinamool MLA's Babri Mosque Event Today, BJP's "Babur" Warning
content: BJP leader Arjun Singh warned Kabir that he would "send him to Babur" if the legislator went ahead with his plan to lay the foundation stone of a Babri mosque replica.

title: Delhi To Reintroduce Double Decker Buses, Check Routes And Fares
content: Double decker buses are set for return to the roads of Delhi, with the government planning to start one such bus from Pradhanmantri Sanghrahalaya to other iconic locations like National War Memorial and Bharat Mandapam.

title: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari Proposes Lowering Juvenile Age To 14
content: Delhi BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said he will propose reducing the juvenile age under the Juvenile Justice Act 2015, to 14 for prosecution against heinous crimes. He plans to propose it by introducing a Private Member's bill in the Lok Sabha.

title: Shashi Tharoor Was Asked If He Would Quit Congress. What He Told NDTV
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor recalled with pride how a word he coined 20 years ago on geopolitical alignments has become truer on Friday.

title: Railways Adds 116 Coaches To 37 Trains Amid IndiGo Cancellations
content: In view of the surge in passenger demand following widespread flight cancellations, the Indian Railways has deployed 116 additional coaches in 37premium trains operating over 114 enhanced trips across the country.

title: Over 3,000 Indian Nationals Deported From US In 2025: Centre
content: In 2025, as of November 21, as many as 3,155 Indian nationals have been deported from the US, the government informed Parliament on Friday.

title: "Attack On US Firms": JD Vance, Marco Rubio On EU Slapping X With Huge Fine
content: The European Union hit Elon Musk's X with a 120-million-euro ($140-million) fine Friday for breaking its digital rules, sparking an angry reaction from Washington.

title: "One Of The Greatest Honours Of My Life": Trump On FIFA Peace Prize Award
content: US President Donald Trump said he was not attending the draw for the 2026 World Cup to receive a prize, but he got one anyway.

title: Maharashtra's Ruling Alliance Presents Report On 1 Year Of Governance
content: The Devendra Fadnavis-led Mahayuti government in Maharashtra completed one successful year of stable, transparent, and result-oriented governance.

title: In UP, Cops Suspended For Dumping Unidentified Body In Another Area
content: Two police personnel including a sub-inspector and a home guard have been suspended for allegedly dumping an unidentified body in another area during the night, officials said on Friday.

title: 12 Labourers From UP Stranded In Kyrgyzstan, Families Allege They Are Being Tortured
content: The Pilibhit district administration has sent a detailed report to the Uttar Pradesh Home Department regarding the case of 12 labourers from the district, who are reportedly stranded and facing harassment in Kyrgyzstan, officials said on Friday.

title: Pro-Khalistan Terrorist Group, Sikh Businessman Sanctioned In UK

title: Swamy Shraddananda‚Äôs mercy petition rejected
content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: Supreme Court on Friday refused to entertain a plea filed by Swamy Shraddananda ‚Äî who is undergoing imprisonment for rest of his natural life for killing his wife ‚Äî seeking direction to govt to take an early decision on his mercy plea. A bench of Justices JK Maheshwari and Vijay Bishnoi asked the petitioner to approach the Karnataka govt for his grievances. Advocate Varun Thakur, appearing for the petitioner, then withdrew the plea to approach the state govt. Shraddananda, 84, alias Murali Manohar Mishra, whose wife was the grand-daughter of a former ‚Äòdewan‚Äô of the princely state of Mysore, had sought a review of the July 2008 verdict of a three-judge SC bench. The apex court had last year refused to entertain a petition filed by Shraddananda, seeking a review of the verdict, which had directed he should remain in prison for the rest of his life.

End of Article

title: Wife‚Äôs suicide threats amount to mental cruelty: HC
content: a woman's repeated threats of dying by suicide amounts to mental cruelty towards her husband . attempts at 'self-harm' and persistent pressure on the husband to convert his religion, too, were amounted to psychological cruelty, the court noted . the wife had challenged the family court order that granted divorce to a resident of Balod district in Chhattisgarh .

title: Deadline ends today, no waqf registration extension: Rijiju
content: the six-month deadline for uploading details, keeping with the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, will end on friday . the ministry has said no penalties or strict action will be initiated for the next three months .

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: The best games, from Duke, Arkansas, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC Men's Challenge featured a bevy of AP top 25 men's college basketball teams . on Tuesday, the ACC came out swinging, with no. 4 Duke escaping an attempted double-digit comeback by no. 15 Florida by a single point . a one-possession victory for no. 16 North Carolina over no. 18 Kentucky ended the night up 6-2 on the SEC .

title: Want a Kalen DeBoer 'Black Hoodie of Death'? Good luck
content: "Excuse me," a woman says as she sifted through the endless round racks of Alabama Crimson Tide apparel . "i was hoping to buy him one of those Coach DeBoer Black Hoodies of Death," she says . all those stores do have plenty of something similar .

title: How the U.S. matches up against group stage foes

title: How the conference championship results affect the playoff: Tulane finishes the job
content: the no. 20 Green Wave dismantled no. 24 North Texas . the committee will watch the group of 5 conference championship games . it will determine their five highest-ranked conference champions . this is the committee's fourth-highest conference champion .

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 14
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easily digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . this guide should help you with all sorts of decision-making, including sit/start, last-minute waiver adds and lineup choices .

title: Does Kirby Smart have an Alabama problem?
content: this season's matchup will fall under the "both" category, marking the fourth time in ten years that the Crimson Tide and Bulldogs have met in Atlanta to determine the conference's champion . it has also resurfaced a fascinating trend: Georgia coach Kirby Smart's struggles to overcome Alabama .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: USC secures its No. 1 spot
content: USC has put itself in position to snap the five-cycle streak of SEC teams finishing with the No. 1-ranked class . some programs, including the no. 1 overall player, Lamar Brown, remain unsigned . there are still questions to be answered and opportunities to make a move in the 2026 class rankings .
